etymology.description: Pictogram of a trident-like weapon/tool (cf. 戈 ‘polearm’ with a single blade); later borrowed for sound (假借) to write the first-person pronoun.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a three-bladed polearm, similar to 戈 but with multiple teeth. Its weapon sense was later repurposed as a phonetic loan to represent ‘I/me,’ so the modern meaning is unrelated to the original picture; the common ‘hand + halberd’ story is a folk etymology.

examples.chinese: 这是给我的(這是給我的)。
请帮我(請幫我)，谢谢(謝謝)。
